english: Breastfeeding is really important for [child name]'s growth and development. Infants and young children should continue breastfeeding until they are 24 months old. After the first 6 months of the child growth the frequency of breastfeeding can be reduced, however, it should not be stopped because from age 6 upto 12 months, breast-milk provides half of the childтАЩs nutritional needs. From 12 months upto 2 years, it continues to provide one-third of the childтАЩs nutritional needs.

english:
Different kinds of nutrients in food are important for: 
Growth - the bones grow in length, muscles develop and all organs inside the body become larger
Learning - For the development of the brain as well, every type of nutrient is needed, and any deficit leads to slow learning.
Activity - Without adequate activity, neither growth nor learning can be adequate. Activity needs a lot of energy, and a lot of the carbohydrate and fat is used up for this.
Fighting against infections- As the child grows up in the first two years, she falls ill often, with fever, diarrhea, or cold and cough. For her body to learn to fight infections, she needs a variety of different nutrients in her diet. Absence of sufficient nutrition can prolong her illnesses; she can lose weight and fall seriously ill.

тЖТ Children can also eat vegetables and pulses that are consumed by the rest of the family. However, since the child is still young, spices should not be added to their food.
тЖТ Before adding spices, remove a small portion of the vegetables or pulses from the rest of the dish and kept aside.

You can make food for your child ahead of time using foodgrains so it is easier for you to prepare meals in the future. The mixture can also be fed to your child if there isnтАЩt fresh food available. The mixture below will stay fresh for up to one month.
The following ingredients are required for the mixture:
тЖТ three parts of any cereal (for example, wheat or flour) OR millet (ragi, bajra, or jowar)
тЖТ one part of any pulse (for example, moong, channa, or arhar)
тЖТ (optional) half part of groundnuts OR white til
тЖТ Roast each ingredient separately, ground and mix all of the ingredients, and store them in an airtight container

To prepare the mixture, follow these steps:
тЖТ Add two tablespoons of the prepared mixture to boiling milk or water
тЖТ Add sugar or jaggery to the mixture and stir
тЖТ Add ghee or oil to the mixture and stir
тЖТ (optional) Add cooked and mashed pumpkin, carrot, or green leafy vegetables to the mixture and stir

english: Children are more likely to attract flies, who cause a lot of diseases, when they are left with poor hygienic conditions, for instance, babies with runny nose or suffering from diarrhea. Moreover, babies inactive at the time of sleep or due to sickness also attract flies.Which is why when we talked previously, we emphasized on the importance of the baby being active. It is also very important that you do not practice open defecation nor do you teach your child to do so since the same is a cause of several diseases and other dangers.

english:
Unsafe and insufficient water supply and inadequate sanitation can compromise with the nutritional status of the child. People suffering from diarrhoea will not benefit fully from food because frequent stools prevents adequate absorption of nutrients. This can lead to malnutrition. \n

Malnutrition affects all age groups, but it is especially common among those with inadequate access to health education and to clean water and good sanitation. Which is why it is extremely important that you take care of the sanitation and hygiene of not just [child name] but the entire family.

english:
Diarrhea and teething are indirectly connected and needs to be paid attention to when it happens. The constant irritation in the gums causes the babies to reach out for different objects, which are then held in the mouth and chewed. These objects may not necessarily be clean and could have germs and other microbes on them. Since babies tend to put everything they can find in their mouth, the chances of bacteria entering the body are extremely high, and hence they may get diarrhoea.
If the diarrhoea manifests primarily when the teething behaviour sets in for the child, the symptoms should usually go away in a few days once the right precautions are taken. However, if the problem continues for around a week or more and tends to repeat every month it is advisable that you take your child to a doctor. Also, make sure to constantly feed the child, more often than usual, and also give ORS since diarrhea causes a loss of nutrients from the body and the same needs to be replenished.

english: An important component of maintaining sanitation and hygiene is the safe disposal of child feces since the same could be a breeding ground for flies, scavengers etc. While crawling or playing, children may put contaminated fingers, pica or fomites into their mouth. The safest way is to dispose the fecal matter in a toilet/latrine. All other methods are considered unsafe.  Problems associated with open defecation include serious respiratory issues, stomach illness (Typhoid and Jaundice), and malaria apart from diarrhea.

english: Hands should be washed on a regular basis, especially after using the washroom/changing the baby's diaper and before breastfeeding the child. Also, breasts should be wiped before breastfeeding the child. Using soap is a simple way to prevent the spread of infection and to keep you and your baby healthy ЁЯС╢ЁЯП╜. Keep the soap next to all water sources in your house to make it easier to wash your hands with soap every time. You should wash your hands for at least 20 seconds as advised by experts and dry them soon after because germs and bacteria spread easily in wet hands.

english:
Did you know that using a baby bottle to feed your child can actually make them sick? ЁЯН╝ Bottles are difficult to clean thoroughly, so germs can unintentionally be transferred to your child. It is recommended by many experts to stop all bottle feeding and switching to exclusive breastfeeding to avoid unintended sickness for your baby ЁЯд▒ЁЯП╜. 
While babies are young, they often put things in their mouths while they are playing ЁЯС╢ЁЯП╜. It's important to keep these objects clean and sanitized so they don't transfer germs to the baby while playing.

english: You should talk to AWW [AWW name] and get [child name]'s height and weight measured every month. It is extremely useful to find out the nutrition status of the child. english: This is known as a Growth Monitoring chart. Every month, your AWW based on the age of your child and their weight, marks a point of the graph. Over a period of time this takes shape of a line that will indicate the nutrition status of your child. The straight line shows the weight which increases as you go upwards and the flat line shows the age which increases as you move right.

RED- if the weight of your child is in this color, it means that (s)he is severely underweight and needs your immediate attention.

GREEN- if the weight of your child is in this color, it means that (s)he is currently in the appropriate weight range and you should continue taking good care of them and addressing their nutritional needs.

english:
One of the different ways the nutrition of a child can be improved is through increased understanding of feeding techniques. While the scope of feeding techniques is vast, some of the things I can tell you about are: 
1) Recognizing signs of hunger in your child 
2) Importance of breastfeeding after the initiation of complementary feeding 
3) Kinds of nutrient rich food that can be given to [child name]
4) Consistency of food when you begin complementary feeding

3) рдкреЛрд╖рдХ рддрддреНрд╡реЛрдВ рд╕реЗ рднрд░рдкреВрд░ рднреЛрдЬрди [рдмрдЪреНрдЪреЗ рдХреЗ рдирд╛рдо] рдХреЛ рджрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЬрд╛ рд╕рдХрддрд╛ рд╣реИ
4) рднреЛрдЬрди рдХреА рд╕рдВрдЧрддрд┐ рдЬрдм рдЖрдк рдКрдкрд░реА рднреЛрдЬрди рд╢реБрд░реВ рдХрд░рддреЗ рд╣реИрдВ

english: With time you will learn how to recognize the [child name]тАЩs way of communicating hunger. She/he might rub the mouth with a fist, start to fuss, or open the mouth wide towards the breast. These are indications that the she/he is ready for breastfeeding. The mother should not wait for the baby to cry before feeding it. Crying is a late sign of hunger.

english: Children older than 6 months still benefit a lot from breastfeeding. From age 6 upto 12 months, breast-milk provides half of the childтАЩs nutritional needs. From 12 months upto 2 years, it continues to provide one-third of a childтАЩs needs. Breast-milk also continues to protect the child from many illnesses, and helps the child grow. Therefore [mother name], you should breastfeed [child name] as often that she/he wants!

english:
A nutrition-rich diet requires a variety of foods. Iron, vitamin A and iodine are very important for development of the brain as well as for childтАЩs growth. Zinc helps to prevent illness.
Sources of important micronutrients-
Best sources for iron: animal meat and organ foods (for example, liver), egg and fish. Among vegetarian foods, soya beans and other pulses, drumstick, coriander, fenugreek curry leaves, mint, beet root and turnip leaves, dry dates, raisins, dry mango powder, water melon and whole wheat flour. 
Best sources for zinc: same as iron. 
Best sources for Vitamin A: Vitamin A contributes to healthy eyes and brain development, and prevents illness. Best sources are animal foods, fish, liver, egg, milk and milk products. In a vegetarian diet the foods rich in vitamin A are sweet potatoes, carrot, yellow pumpkin, spinach, fenugreek, sarson (mustard), parwal, papaya, musk melon, orange, sweet lime and mango 
Iodine is available in iodized salt. It is very important for brain development.

Responsive feeding means gently encouragingтАФ not forcingтАФthe child to eat. Showing interest, smiling, or offering an extra bit encourages the child to eat. You can also play games to help [child name] to eat enough food and to try new foods. 
For example: тАЬOpen wide for the bird to come inside.тАЭ OR тАЬI will take a bite first. Yum. Yum. Now it is your turn to take a bite.тАЭ Both the caregiver and the child feel encouraged and happy when the child eats well.

english:
Here are a few points about responsive feeding: 
тАв Till the time [child name] cannot eat by herself/himself you should feed her/him directly and as she/he gets older you can help her/him feed themselves. Feed slowly and patiently. Encourage [child name] to eat, but do not force her/him.
тАв If [child name] refuse many foods, experiment with different food combinations, tastes, textures, and methods of encouragement. 
тАв Minimize distractions during meals, if [child name] loses interest easily. 
тАв Remember that feeding times are periods of learning and affection тАУ talk to her/him during feeding, with eye to eye contact.
